xxl.core.io.converters
Class AsciiConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<T>
      xxl.core.io.converters.SizeConverter<T>
          xxl.core.io.converters.FixedSizeConverter<Character>
              xxl.core.io.converters.CharacterConverter
                  xxl.core.io.converters.AsciiConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class AsciiConverter
extends CharacterConverter

This class provides a converter that is able to read and write Character objects as ASCII characters (the byte values representing the ASCII character). In addition to the read and write methods that read or write Character objects this class contains readChar and writeChar methods that convert the Character object after reading or before writing it to its primitive char type.

Example usage (1). 

     // catch IOExceptions

     try {

         // create a byte array output stream

         ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();

         // write a Character and a char value to the output stream

         AsciiConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), new Character('C'));
         AsciiConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.writeChar(new DataOutputStream(output), 'b');

         // create a byte array input stream on the output stream

         ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());

         // read a char value and a Character from the input stream

         char c1 = AsciiConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.readByte(new DataInputStream(input));
         Character c2 = (Character)AsciiConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));

         // print the value and the object

         System.out.println(c1);
         System.out.println(c2);

         // close the streams after use

         input.close();
         output.close();
     }
     catch (IOException ioe) {
         System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
     }

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final AsciiConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of an ASCII converter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of an ASCII converter.

SIZE

public static final int SIZE
This field contains the number of bytes needed to serialize the byte value representing the ASCII character of a Character object. Because this size is predefined it must not be measured each time.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

AsciiConverter

public AsciiConverter()
Sole constructor. (For invocation by subclass constructors, typically implicit.)

Method Detail

read

public Character read(DataInput dataInput,
                      Character object)
               throws IOException
Reads the byte value representing the ASCII character for the specified (Character) object from the specified data input and returns the restored object.

This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new Character object. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.

Overrides:
read in class CharacterConverter
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the byte value representing the ASCII character from in order to return a Character object.
object - the (Character) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
Returns:
the read Character object.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  Character object)
           throws IOException
Writes the byte value representing the ASCII character of the specified Character object to the specified data output.

Overrides:
write in class CharacterConverter
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the byte value representing the ASCII character of the specified Character object to.
object - the Character object that byte value representing the ASCII character should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
The main method contains some examples how to use an ASCII converter. It can also be used to test the functionality of an ASCII converter.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
